questionsJson.correctAnswer: var person = {firstName: 'John', lastName: 'Doe', age: 50, eyeColor: 'blue'}

options: Refers to the object it belongs to
questionsJson.correctAnswer: Refers to the object it belongs to

questionsJson.question: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: A function that has access to the parent scope, even after the parent function has closed
A function that returns a value
questionsJson.correctAnswer: A function that has access to the parent scope, even after the parent function has closed

questionsJson.question: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: '==' compares values, '===' compares values and types
'===' compares values, '==' compares values and types
They are not used in JavaScript
questionsJson.correctAnswer: '==' compares values, '===' compares values and types

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'typeof' operator in JavaScript?
options: To check if a variable is defined
To determine the data type of a variable
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To determine the data type of a variable

options: To remove an event listener from an element
To add an event listener to an element
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To add an event listener to an element

options: To convert a JavaScript object into a JSON string
To create a new JSON object

options: To convert a JavaScript object into a JSON string
To create a new JSON object

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'setInterval()' method in JavaScript?
options: To execute a function once after a specified time
To execute a function repeatedly at specified intervals
To stop the execution of a function
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To execute a function repeatedly at specified intervals

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'setTimeout()' method in JavaScript?
options: To execute a function repeatedly at specified intervals
To execute a function once after a specified time
To stop the execution of a function
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To execute a function once after a specified time

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'map()' method in JavaScript?
options: To filter elements in an array
To apply a function to each element in an array and return a new array
To sort elements in an array
To reduce an array to a single value
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To apply a function to each element in an array and return a new array

questionsJson.question: Explain the concept of prototypal inheritance in JavaScript.
options: A way to inherit properties and methods from another object
questionsJson.correctAnswer: A way to inherit properties and methods from another object

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'async' and 'await' keywords in JavaScript?
options: To handle asynchronous operations in a more readable way
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To handle asynchronous operations in a more readable way

options: To define custom behavior for fundamental operations on an object

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'WeakMap' and 'WeakSet' objects in JavaScript?
options: To store data that can be garbage collected if there are no other references to it
To store data that cannot be garbage collected
To store data in a specific order
To store data with a specific type
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To store data that can be garbage collected if there are no other references to it

options: A way to create web servers
A way to run scripts in the background, separate from a web page

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'requestAnimationFrame()' method in JavaScript?
questionsJson.correctAnswer: To create animations

questionsJson.question: What is the purpose of the 'WebAssembly' (Wasm) technology?
options: To run high-performance code in web browsers

options: A loop that handles events in a specific order
A loop that allows JavaScript to perform non-blocking operations
A loop that modifies the DOM

options: To observe changes to the DOM

options: A way to create web servers
A way to organize JavaScript code into reusable units
